intro: Westia, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southern regions of South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its ability to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. Westia species produce showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. These plants are often cultivated as ornamental shrubs for their attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
